welcomePage.title: Eclipse Java Development Tools (JDT)

intro.p: This page will help familiarize you with the Eclipse Java development tooling. To get started, read the sections below and click on the related links.

welcomePage.item: The Java Perspectives To do Java development open to the Java Perspective Window > Open Perspective > Java. Alternatively, if you prefer a more browser-like user interface then open to the Java Browsing Perspective Window > Open Perspective > Java Browsing.

Create Java components To start, first create a Java Project. Next create a Package within that Project using File > New > Package (use the Browse... button to select your project if it is not already listed in Source Folder field). To create a Java class, use the Java Class wizard File > New > Class (again use the Browse... buttons within the wizard to select the appropriate Project and Package for your class).

Installing the Examples Clicking on http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/index.php opens the Eclipse download page. Select a build, scroll down to the "Example Plug-ins" section on the upcoming page and follow the install instructions.

JUnit Example If you have installed the examples then a complete JUnit example project is provided for you to explore File > New > Other... In the left column of this wizard, expand the category Examples and select Java. Double click on Example Project - JUnit in the right column and, on the next page, click Finish.

Running a Java Program To run any Java program, click on Run > Run.... Select Java Application as the launch configuration and click New. Identify the program in the Project and Class fields and then click Run.

Learn More To learn more you can read the Java Development User Guide. Browse the JDT Icons section to recognize the various language elements. Check the FAQ to see if your question is already answered there.
